answer: Admissions open twice a year. Students can apply online by submitting required academic documents.
Required documents include academic transcripts, CNIC or B-Form, photographs, and admission form.
Admissions usually open in Spring and Fall semesters.
Semester fees depend on the academic program. Please contact the accounts office for exact details.
Scholarships are available based on merit and financial need.
Fees can be paid through bank challan or approved payment methods.
Students can apply for hostel accommodation through the administration office.
Hostel facilities include furnished rooms, electricity, water, and security.
Students must follow hostel rules including discipline, timings, and cleanliness.
The university follows a GPA-based grading system.
Students must maintain at least 75% attendance to appear in exams.
Course registration is done at the beginning of each semester through the student portal.
The library is open during official working hours on weekdays.
Students can borrow a limited number of books for a specific duration.
Digital resources and online journals are available through the university library system.
